item.title: A Practical Introduction to Probability Theory (minicourse)
item.author: web@bochkarev.io (Alexey A. Bochkarev)
item.description: This is a quick numerical intro to probability theory in the form of a mini-course, four one-hour sessions. Designed for SMTB and Puschino Winter School in 2021. Discussing mathematical models for random things from the perspective of numerical examples in Python.

item.description: A summary note on OR Tech Seminar topics and logistics. (A “research toolbox” discussion, a series of seminars organized under the umbrella of CU INFORMS Student Chapter.)

item.title: A Glimpse into Algorithms (minicourse)
item.author: web@bochkarev.io (Alexey A. Bochkarev)
item.description: This is a quick computational intro to algorithms and data structures in the form of a mini-course, four one-hour sessions. Designed and presented for SMTB in 2020 and 2021. Quick numerical illustrations for runtime, correctness, and other such fun things.

item.title: A mind-map for (some) basic OR topics
item.author: web@bochkarev.io (Alexey A. Bochkarev)
item.description: An attempt to summarize some key OR concepts, inspired by the IE/OR Qualifying exams scope in 2019. Designed as an easy-to-overview mindmap.

item.title: An Euler diagram for convexity generalizations
item.author: web@bochkarev.io (Alexey A. Bochkarev)
item.description: A one-page, visual summary of various concepts generalizing “convexity” (i.e., quasiconvexity and such) with simple 2D examples.

item.title: Dotplot sample generation utility
item.author: web@bochkarev.io (Alexey A. Bochkarev)
item.description: A utility to facilitate the discussion of the dot-plot concept. Written in R with ggplot.
